Interface GameObserver

All Known Implementing Classes:
GuiController, SoundManager
public interface GameObserver
Defines the contract for components that wish to listen to game events.

Design Pattern: Observer
This interface facilitates loose coupling between the Game Logic (Subject) and the UI/Sound systems (Observers). The GameController notifies all registered observers whenever the game state changes, without needing to know the specific implementation details of the listeners.

  • Method Details

    • onBoardUpdated

      void onBoardUpdated(ViewData viewData)
      Triggered when the active falling brick moves, rotates, or spawns.

      Used by the View to redraw the dynamic elements of the board (active piece, ghost piece).

      Parameters:
      viewData - a snapshot containing the current piece coordinates and shape.

    • onGameBackgroundUpdated

      void onGameBackgroundUpdated(int[][] boardMatrix)
      Triggered when the static background grid changes (e.g., when a piece locks or rows are cleared).

      Used by the View to repaint the locked blocks on the grid.

      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - the 2D array representing the color codes of locked blocks.

    • onScoreUpdated

      void onScoreUpdated(int score)
      Triggered when the player's score increases.
      Parameters:
      score - the new total score.

    • onLevelUpdated

      void onLevelUpdated(int level)
      Triggered when the player advances to a new level. This usually implies an increase in game speed.
      Parameters:
      level - the new level number.

    • onLineCleared

      void onLineCleared(int lines, String message)
      Triggered when one or more rows are cleared.

      Used to display visual notifications (e.g., "TETRIS!") or play celebration sounds.

      Parameters:
      lines - the number of lines cleared in this event.
      message - the notification text associated with the clear (e.g., "Single", "Double").

    • onGameOver

      void onGameOver()
      Triggered when the game ends (Game Over). Used to stop music, show the game-over screen, and display final scores.

    • onBrickDropped

      void onBrickDropped()
      Triggered when a brick lands (soft drop or hard drop). Primarily used by the audio system to play a landing sound effect.

    • onDangerStateChanged

      void onDangerStateChanged(boolean isDanger)
      Triggered when the "Danger" state changes.

      The game enters a danger state when the stack reaches a critical height. Observers can use this to play intense music or shake the screen.

      Parameters:
      isDanger - true if the game is in a critical state; false otherwise.
